location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 1420 of 1826 from William Newnham, Secretary to the Governor of Bombay, Bombay Castle, to the Resident in the Persian Gulf at Bushire [Ephraim Gerrish Stannus]

mods.abstract: William Newnham tansmits a copy of a letter from a person representing himself as belonging to His Majesty's Ship Martin, left in a distressed situation at Siuee [Siyu?], a place on the East Coast of Africa, together with translations of letters received from the chiefs of that and neighbouring places, and one from His Highness the Imaum [Imam] of Muscat.Enclosures:Letter dated 23 September 1826 from Robert Hele, late mate of the HMS Martinat Seeuee, East Coast of Africa;Substance of a letter from Sooltan Foomloot ben Sooltan Bareeh Shaik-ool-rubhanee [Chief of Seuee] to the Honorable the Governor of Bombay, dated 19 Seefeer [á¹¢afar] 1242 Hijree [Hijri] or 22 September 1826;Substance of a letter from the Shaiks of Seeuee [Siyu?];Letter no. 1387 of 1826 to the Secretary to Government at the Mauritius from William Newnham, Secretary to the Governor of Bombay, dated 18 December 1826;Letter no. 1421 of 1826 to the Persian Secretary from William Newnham, Secretary to the Governor of Bombay, dated 26 December 1826;Letter no 1419 of 1826 to His Excellency Hood Hanway Christian, Commodore of His Majesty's Squadron on the Cape Station, from Mountstuart Elphinstone, T Bradford, Francis Warden and Richard Thomas Goodwin, dated 26 December 1826.
